item.title: Crysis 2 back on Steam
item.dc:creator: Nightblade
item.description:
gibbelin:

Also, Crysis 1 and Warhead are phenomenal. Open-ended freeform combat, tons of emergent gameplay…I will never understand why people say they’re just generic, pretty shooters. They aren’t. You’ll like them.

Crysis 2 is a great linear shooter. Not linear like COD or something, more in the vein of Halo, with sever large, open set pieces. Most of the awesome sim elements are gone as well, but it’s still a really good game. Just know what you’re getting into.

Yeah, I do expect I will. I buy from a ton of different genres and best way I’ve figured out if I will like a game or not is when I ask myself; “do you like what this game is trying to be? Does it reach what it’s grasping for?”
If the answer to either of those is no then I don’t buy it.

I’m really glad that the CryEngine and it’s games have come to where they are. The Unreal Engine can’t sit by nearly as comfortably as it could 8 years ago. It’s especially heartening what with how depressing it is to see Sweeny licking Nvidia’s boots and denegrating the PC in favour of consoles that belong to the middle of the last decade, while at the same time endorsing Nvidia who is predominantly known for producing PC graphics cards?
Lol wut?
I can haz contradiction? :S

EDIT:

Oh yeah, thanks for sharing that CryEngine3 demo Ryλn, it was awesome!

item.title: Crysis 2 back on Steam
item.dc:creator: Nightblade
item.description:
Well it’s not the same edition as the one that you bought though.
It’s been re-released on Steam because the value of all the DLC packages has been integrated into the price.
Seeing as you already own the base game you can upgrade to the maximum edition for half price till 12 June for $20.

I’m mostly excited about this because I’m about to buy a new PC and I haven’t played any of the Crysis games.
